headline: Ohio's first coronavirus cases were announced two years ago
sentences: While current hospitalizations are finally down to levels where they were this past summer before the Delta variant hit, there have been more than 2 million confirmed cases of COVID in those two years, with some Ohioans infected more than once.

Since then, there have been 37,146 COVID deaths in Ohio.
Sports stopped, bars and restaurants were closed, and the polls shuttered for the March primary as mail in voting was extended, and the first COVID death in Ohio was recorded March 20.
In the next two weeks, K-12 schools were closed, public events with more than 100 people were banned, nursing homes and psychiatric hospitals were shut down to visitors.
"From what we see around the world and the United States, this disease will for a period, will for a period, significantly disrupt our lives," DeWine said.

That total of COVID deaths in Ohio is about the same as the population of Hilliard.
That includes 16,201 people in Ohio who have died of COVID since Labor Day 2021.
Or it’s the total of the populations of Maple Heights and Marietta.
Two years ago today, the coronavirus officially arrived in Ohio.
Or all the residents of Medina and Coshocton added together.
